definition: to admit defeat/to give in/to acknowledge a mistake/to apologize/to be amenable to persuasion
classifier for medicine: dose/Taiwan pr. [fu2]

clothes/dress/garment/to serve (in the military, a prison sentence etc)/to obey/to be convinced (by an argument)/to convince/to admire/to acclimatize/to take (medicine)/mourning clothes/to wear mourning clothes
soft/flexible
variant of 軟|软[ruan3]

sentences.english: After a ruinous strike, the union caved in.
sentences.chinese: 一场破坏性的罢工之后，工会突然服软了。

sentences.english: It is said that many people are serving hard against soft.
sentences.chinese: 这是说，许多人都是服硬不服软的。

sentences.english: Your clothes, more than any promise, it tells me that you love me so much.
sentences.chinese: 你的服软，胜过任何诺言，它告诉我，你是如此爱我。

sentences.english: One more shot, G falls down reluctantly.
sentences.chinese: 海蒂很酷地补一枪，朱很不情愿倒下服软。

sentences.english: We can not be soft with evil forces.
sentences.chinese: 对于恶势力，我们不能服软。

definition: to move aside/to get out of the way/to back down/to concede
to concede/to admit defeat
lit. eats soft food, but refuses hard food (idiom)/amenable to coaxing but not coercion
to admit an error/to acknowledge one's mistake
reluctant to admit a mistake
to regard face as all-important/to consider loss of face unthinkable
to beg forgiveness
see 愛面子|爱面子[ai4 mian4 zi5]
see 撕破臉|撕破脸[si1 po4 lian3]
to act shamelessly/to behave in a way that leaves others tut-tutting and shaking their heads in disapproval
not to fight back/to take it lying down/to show weakness/to show one's softer side
to fall out with sb/to become hostile
to pester endlessly (idiom)/an annoying troublemaker
to concede/to admit defeat/to admit sth is wrong after insisting it is right
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
unmoved by force or persuasion
